verses.verse: Festus <S%G5347><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> having come <S%G1910><s%> into the province, <S%G1885><s%> after <S%G3326><s%> three <S%G5140><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> went up <S%G305><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Caesarea. <S%G2542><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> the high priest <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the principal <S%G4413><s%> men of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> informed <S%G1718><s%> him <S%G846><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> they begged <S%G3870><s%> him, <S%G846><s%>

asking <S%G5485><s%> a favor <S%G5485><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> that <S%G3704><s%> he would summon <S%G3343><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem; <S%G2419><s%> <S%G4160><s%> plotting <S%G1747><s%> to kill <S%G337><s%> him <S%G846><s%> on <S%G2596><s%> the way. <S%G3598><s%>

However <S%G3767><s%> <S%G99999><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> that Paul <S%G3972><s%> should <S%G3195><s%> be kept <S%G5083><s%> in custody at <S%G1722><s%> Caesarea, <S%G2542><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> that he himself <S%G1438><s%> was about to depart <S%G1607><s%> <S%G1722><s%> shortly. <S%G5034><s%>

"Let them <S%G3588><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%>" said he, <S%G5346><s%> "that <S%G3588><s%> are in power <S%G1415><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> you <S%G5213><s%> go down with <S%G4782><s%> me, <S%G1487><s%> and if there is <S%G2076><s%> anything <S%G5100><s%> wrong <S%G1722><s%> in <S%G3588><s%> the man, <S%G5129><s%> let them accuse <S%G846><s%> <S%G2723><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>"

When he had stayed <S%G1304><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> them <S%G846><s%> more <S%G4119><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> ten <S%G1176><s%> days, <S%G2250><s%> he went down <S%G2597><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea, <S%G2542><s%> and on <S%G1909><s%> the next day <S%G1887><s%> he sat <S%G2523><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the judgment seat, <S%G968><s%> and commanded <S%G2753><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> to be brought. <S%G71><s%>

<S%G1161><s%> When <S%G3854><s%> he <S%G846><s%> had come, <S%G3854><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> who <S%G3588><s%> had come down <S%G2597><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%> stood around <S%G4026><s%> him, <S%G5342><s%> bringing against <S%G2596><s%> him <S%G3972><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> grievous <S%G926><s%> charges <S%G157><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> they could <S%G2480><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> prove, <S%G584><s%>

while <S%G3754><s%> he said <S%G626><s%> in his <S%G846><s%> defense, <S%G3777><s%> "Neither against <S%G1519><s%> the law <S%G3551><s%> of the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> nor <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> the temple, <S%G2411><s%> nor <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> Caesar, <S%G2541><s%> have I sinned <S%G264><s%> at all. <S%G5100><s%>"

But <S%G1161><s%> Festus, <S%G5347><s%> desiring <S%G2309><s%> to gain <S%G2698><s%> favor <S%G5485><s%> with the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> and said, <S%G2036><s%> "Are you <S%G2309><s%> willing to go up <S%G305><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> and be judged <S%G2919><s%> by <S%G1909><s%> me <S%G1700><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> these things? <S%G5130><s%>"

But <S%G1161><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> said, <S%G2036><s%> "I <S%G1510><s%> am standing <S%G2476><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> Caesar <S%G2541><s%>'s judgment seat, <S%G968><s%> where <S%G3757><s%> I <S%G3165><s%> ought <S%G1163><s%> to be tried. <S%G2919><s%> I have done <S%G91><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> wrong <S%G91><s%> to the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> you <S%G4771><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> know <S%G1921><s%> very well. <S%G2566><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> <S%G99999><s%> I have done wrong, <S%G91><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> have committed <S%G4238><s%> anything <S%G5100><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death, <S%G2288><s%> I don't <S%G3756><s%> refuse <S%G3868><s%> to die; <S%G599><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> none <S%G3762><s%> of those things is <S%G2076><s%> true that <S%G3739><s%> they <S%G3778><s%> accuse <S%G2723><s%> me <S%G3450><s%> of, <S%G3762><s%> no one can <S%G1410><s%> give <S%G5483><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> up to them. <S%G846><s%> I appeal to <S%G1941><s%> Caesar! <S%G2541><s%>"

Then <S%G5119><s%> Festus, <S%G5347><s%> when he had conferred <S%G4814><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> the council, <S%G4824><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> "You have appealed <S%G1941><s%> to Caesar. <S%G2541><s%> To <S%G1909><s%> Caesar <S%G2541><s%> you shall go. <S%G4198><s%>"

Now <S%G1161><s%> when some <S%G5100><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> had passed, <S%G1230><s%> King <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Bernice <S%G959><s%> arrived <S%G2658><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea, <S%G2542><s%> and greeted <S%G782><s%> Festus. <S%G5347><s%>

<S%G1161><s%> As <S%G5613><s%> he stayed <S%G1304><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> many <S%G4119><s%> days, <S%G2250><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> laid <S%G394><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%>'s case <S%G2596><s%> before the king, <S%G935><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "There is <S%G2076><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G435><s%> left <S%G2641><s%> a prisoner <S%G1198><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> Felix; <S%G5344><s%>

about <S%G4012><s%> whom, <S%G3739><s%> when I <S%G3450><s%> was <S%G1096><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> the chief priests <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the elders <S%G4245><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> informed <S%G1718><s%> me, <S%G154><s%> asking for a sentence <S%G1349><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

To <S%G4314><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I answered <S%G3754><s%> that it is <S%G2076><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> the custom <S%G1485><s%> of the Romans <S%G4514><s%> to give up <S%G5483><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> destruction, <S%G684><s%> before <S%G4250><s%> the <S%G2228><s%> <S%G3588><s%> accused <S%G2723><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> met the accusers <S%G2725><s%> face <S%G4383><s%> to <S%G2596><s%> face, <S%G4383><s%> and <S%G5037><s%> has <S%G2983><s%> had opportunity <S%G5117><s%> to make his defense <S%G627><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> the matter laid against him. <S%G1462><s%>

When therefore <S%G3767><s%> they <S%G846><s%> had come <S%G4905><s%> together here, <S%G1759><s%> I <S%G4160><s%> didn't <S%G3367><s%> delay, <S%G311><s%> but on the next day <S%G1836><s%> sat <S%G2523><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the judgment seat, <S%G968><s%> and commanded <S%G2753><s%> the man <S%G435><s%> to be brought. <S%G71><s%>

Concerning <S%G4012><s%> whom, <S%G3739><s%> when the accusers <S%G2725><s%> stood up, <S%G2476><s%> they brought <S%G2018><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> charge <S%G156><s%> of such things <S%G3739><s%> as I <S%G1473><s%> supposed; <S%G5282><s%>

but <S%G1161><s%> had <S%G2192><s%> certain <S%G5100><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> against <S%G4314><s%> him <S%G846><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> their own <S%G2398><s%> religion, <S%G1175><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> one <S%G5100><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> who was dead, <S%G2348><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> affirmed <S%G5335><s%> to be alive. <S%G2198><s%>

<S%G1161><s%> <S%G1473><s%> Being <S%G639><s%> perplexed <S%G639><s%> how <S%G5127><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> inquire <S%G4012><s%> concerning these things, <S%G2214><s%> I asked <S%G3004><s%> whether <S%G1487><s%> he was willing <S%G1014><s%> to go <S%G4198><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2419><s%> and there <S%G2546><s%> be judged <S%G2919><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> these matters. <S%G5130><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> when Paul <S%G3972><s%> had appealed <S%G1941><s%> <S%G846><s%> to be kept <S%G5083><s%> for <S%G1519><s%> the decision <S%G1233><s%> of the emperor, <S%G4575><s%> I commanded <S%G2753><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to be kept <S%G5083><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> <S%G3739><s%> I could send <S%G3992><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> Caesar. <S%G2541><s%>"

<S%G1161><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> Festus, <S%G5347><s%> "I also <S%G2532><s%> would <S%G1014><s%> like to hear <S%G191><s%> the man <S%G444><s%> myself. <S%G1161><s%>" "Tomorrow, <S%G839><s%>" he <S%G5346><s%> said, <S%G191><s%> "you shall hear him. <S%G846><s%>"

So <S%G3767><s%> on the next day, <S%G1887><s%> when Agrippa <S%G67><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Bernice <S%G959><s%> had come <S%G2064><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> great <S%G4183><s%> pomp, <S%G5325><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> they had entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the place of hearing <S%G201><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> <S%G99999><s%> the commanding officers <S%G5506><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> principal <S%G1851><s%> <S%G99999><s%> men <S%G435><s%> of the city, <S%G4172><s%> at <S%G2596><s%> the command <S%G2753><s%> of <S%G2532><s%> Festus, <S%G5347><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> was brought in. <S%G71><s%>

<S%G2532><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> said, <S%G5346><s%> "King <S%G935><s%> Agrippa, <S%G67><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> all men <S%G3956><s%> who <S%G3588><s%> are here present <S%G4840><s%> with us, <S%G2254><s%> you see <S%G2334><s%> this <S%G5126><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the multitude <S%G4128><s%> of the Jews <S%G2453><s%> petitioned <S%G1793><s%> me, <S%G3427><s%> both <S%G5037><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> here, <S%G1759><s%> crying that <S%G1916><s%> he <S%G846><s%> ought <S%G1163><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> to live <S%G2198><s%> any longer. <S%G3371><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> when I <S%G1473><s%> found <S%G2638><s%> that he <S%G846><s%> had committed <S%G4238><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death, <S%G2288><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> as he <S%G5127><s%> <S%G1161><s%> himself <S%G846><s%> appealed <S%G1941><s%> to the emperor <S%G4575><s%> I determined <S%G2919><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

Of <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> certain <S%G804><s%> thing <S%G5100><s%> to write <S%G1125><s%> to my lord. <S%G2962><s%> Therefore <S%G1352><s%> I have brought <S%G4254><s%> him <S%G846><s%> forth <S%G4254><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> you, <S%G5216><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> especially <S%G3122><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> you, <S%G4675><s%> King <S%G935><s%> Agrippa, <S%G67><s%> that, <S%G3704><s%> after examination, <S%G351><s%> <S%G1096><s%> I may have <S%G1096><s%> something <S%G5100><s%> to write. <S%G1125><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> it seems <S%G1380><s%> to me <S%G3427><s%> unreasonable, <S%G249><s%> in sending <S%G3992><s%> a prisoner, <S%G1198><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> to also <S%G2532><s%> specify <S%G4591><s%> the charges <S%G156><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>"
